title: Smn theorem
summary: In computability theory the S mn  theorem, (also called the translation lemma, parameter theorem, and the parameterization theorem) is a basic result about programming languages (and, more generally, Gödel numberings of the computable functions) (Soare 1987, Rogers 1967).  It was first proved by Stephen Cole Kleene (1943). The name S mn  comes from the occurrence of an S with subscript n and superscript m in the original formulation of the theorem (see below).
